page.title: 05HISTORY
page.content: Archaeological remains show evidence of Stone Age, Early Christian, Viking and Celtic settlements. In the Middle Ages the island was part of the endowment of the Benedctine Monestry of Iona. It later became part of the lands of Macdonald of Clanranald. Thereafter it was owned by only three families before coming into the care of the National Trust for Scotland in 1981. The Earth houses or souterrains and the Viking Graves are two interesting archaeogical sites on Canna,but as yet unexplored.Celtic remains include a nunnery and a cross at Keill which is near the site of st Columba's original chapel.
